Important – Disclosure of Material Facts. In many jurisdictions, policies of insurance (and reinsurance) are subject to the doctrine of utmost good faith which means that the policyholder is under a duty to disclose all material facts. A material fact is one which may affect the judgement of a reasonable or prudent underwriter in deciding whether or not to accept the risk and if so, on what terms. Failure to disclose all material facts could prejudice your rights to recover in the event of a claim or may allow insurers (and/or reinsurers) to void the policy from its inception. The duty of disclosure is ongoing and applies from the moment discussion commences with insurers, throughout the period of insurance and at renewal. Any change in facts previously advised could be material and should also be notified. If you have any doubt as to what constitutes a material fact, then please do not hesitate to contact us. The duty of disclosure and the consequences of its breach will vary dependent upon the law applicable to the insurance and/or reinsurance contract.

Premium payment

Please ensure that the insurance premium due as per the attached Tax Invoice from the Insurer is paid immediately to avoid disruptions to the coverage. If this condition is not complied with, it may jeopardize the coverage provided and, in some cases, even render the insurance policy null and void. 

Please note cash payments are not permissible, settlement of the premium must be made by cheque or bank transfer only. 

 

You may please note that the Tax Invoice of the Insurer has shown the applicable insurance premium and the Value Added Tax (VAT) thereon that has been implemented by law in the United Arab Emirates with effect from 1st January 2018. If you are a VAT registrant and the Tax Invoice does not reflect your TRN or the TRN printed on the Invoice is incorrect, please let us know immediately together with your Tax Registration Certificate (if not already provided to us) so that we shall ask the Insurer to provide the corrected Tax Invoice forthwith.

 

Please ensure that settlement of the premium is made in the same Original Currency as printed on the Tax Invoice. We shall very much appreciate if you are able to let us know as soon as the remittance of premium is made to the Insurer in order for us to verify safe receipt of the premium by the Insurer.

Failure to disclose all material facts could prejudice your rights to recover in the event of a claim or may allow insurers (and/or reinsurers) to render the insurance policy void from its inception. 

 

The duty of disclosure is ongoing and applies from the moment discussion commences with insurers, throughout the period of insurance and at renewal. Any change in facts previously advised could be material and should also be notified. If you have any doubt as to what constitutes a material fact, then please do not hesitate to contact us. The duty of disclosure and the consequences of its breach will vary dependent upon the law applicable to the insurance contract. The duty of disclosure and the consequences of its breach will vary dependent upon the law applicable to the insurance and/or reinsurance contract.

We would also like to take this opportunity to remind you of the following:

 

Premium payment

Please ensure that the insurance premium due as per the attached Tax Invoice from the Insurer is paid immediately to avoid disruptions to the coverage. chunks.text:
Please ensure that the insurance premium due as per the attached Tax Invoice from the Insurer is paid immediately to avoid disruptions to the coverage. If this condition is not complied with, it may jeopardize the coverage provided and, in some cases, even render the insurance policy null and void. 

Please note cash payments are not permissible, settlement of the premium must be made by cheque or bank transfer only. 

 

You may please note that the Tax Invoice of the Insurer has shown the applicable insurance premium and the Value Added Tax (VAT) thereon that has been implemented by law in the United Arab Emirates with effect from 1st January 2018. If you are a VAT registrant and the Tax Invoice does not reflect your TRN or the TRN printed on the Invoice is incorrect, please let us know immediately together with your Tax Registration Certificate (if not already provided to us) so that we shall ask the Insurer to provide the corrected Tax Invoice forthwith.

 

Please ensure that settlement of the premium is made in the same Original Currency as printed on the Tax Invoice. We shall very much appreciate if you are able to let us know as soon as the remittance of premium is made to the Insurer in order for us to verify safe receipt of the premium by the Insurer.

 

Material Facts (Duty of Disclosure)
